full_text: 7S are Els IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM 2020/KER/LI7 PRESENT THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE ASHOK MENON MONDAY, THE O6TH DAY OF JANUARY 2020 / 16TH POUSHA, 1941 Cr1.MC.No.7350 OF 2019 (G) AGAINST THE ORDER/JUDGMENT IN CC 925/2016 OF JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT, KALAMASSERY CRIME NO.224/2006 OF Eloor Police Station , Ernakulam PETITIONER/S: 1 DANIEL AGED 52 YEARS S/O. THANKACHAN, THAIPARAMBIL VEEDU, KIZHAKKUMBHAGOM, ELOOR, ERNAKULAM DISTRICT. 2 VARGHESE @ DEEDI AGED 45 YEARS S/O. THANKACHAN, THAITPARAMBIL VEEDU, KIZHAKKUMBHAGOM, ELOOR, ERNAKULAM DISTRICT. BY ADV. SRI.MANSOOR.B.H. RESPONDENT/S: 1 STATE OF KERALA REPRESENTED BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM - 682 031. 2 STATION HOUSE OFFICER ELOOR EAST POLICE STATION, ERNAKULAM DISTRICT - 682 302. 3 STANLEY, AGED 49 YEARS S/O. CHRISTUDAS, ANTHAIKKATTU VEEDU, KIZHAKUMBHAGOM, ELOOR, ERNAKULAM DISTRICT - 682 302. R3 BY ADV. B.H.ANSIL OTHER PRESENT: RAMESH CHAND-PP THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 06.01.2020, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: Crl.MC.No.7350 OF 2019(G) 2 2020/KER/LI7 ORDER Dated this the 6th day of January 2020 Petitioners are accused in C.C No.925/2016 on the files of the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Kalamassery for having allegedly committed offences punishable under Sections 341,332, 294(b), 506(i) r/w Section 34 of IPC. 2. The de facto complainant and injured is the 3" respondent, who has appeared through counsel and filed affidavit to the effect that the matter has been amicably settled with the petitioners and that he has no grievance against them. Even though Section 332 is incorporated in the final report, it is doubtful whether Section 332 is attracted because there is no allegation to the effect that the injured was in the process of performing his official duty. The mere fact that he was traveling in a police jeep as driver of the jeep, is not sufficient to attract Section 332. A report has been called for from the investigating officer to the effect that the matter has been settled between the parties. Petitioners and the 3 respondent are relatives and Crl.MC.No.7350 OF 2019(G) 3 2020/KER/LI7 the family disputes between them have been settled amicably. No public interest is involved. In the result, the Crl.M.C is allowed and the entire proceedings in C.C. No.925/2016 pending on the files of the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Kalamassery stands quashed under Section 482 of Cr.P.C and the accused are discharged. Sd/- ASHOK MENON JUDGE rmm 7S mi Eee Crl.MC.No.7350 OF 2019(G) 4 2020/KER/LI7 APPENDIX PETITIONER'S/S EXHIBITS: ANNEXURE A COPY OF THE FINAL REPORT IN CRIME NO.224/2006 OF ELOOR POLICE STATION. ANNEXURE B AFFIDAVIT OF THIRD RESPONDENT ANNEXURE co AFFIDAVIT OF THIRD RESPONDENT.
